accused.name: Marguitte femme Jean Jacquot
accused.origin: le Paire in ban de Moyenmoustier

confession.seduction_date: 14 or 16 years earlier, during first marriage
confession.seduction_context: Time of great famine, when fetching wood near Sauceray. Persin asked if they were so poor they had no animals to carry wood but had to carry it on shoulders. Promised her a lot of money so she would no longer be hungry. Money turned out to be oak leaves.
sabbat_activities: taken and brought back in air by master

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: 2 days after she entered house and looked over animals

testimony.quarrel_subject: Had taken Jean Grand Didier to court seeking reparation for execrable words against his late father, and summoned her as witness. She refused several times until forced by court and conceived hatred against witness.

witnesses.name: Marguitte veuve Claudon Claude Jean Mariatte
Mengeotte femme Demenge Didier le Moullot

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: 2 days after she entered house and looked over animals

timeline.subject: Marguitte femme Jean Jacquot
timeline.details: Confrontation with Jean Grand Didier (alias Remeguey) who maintained accusation. She admitted it was true and confessed to seduction by Persin.

timeline.subject: Marguitte femme Jean Jacquot
timeline.details: Full interrogation with detailed confession about seduction, powder, sabbat attendance, killing cow, killing Jean Parmentier, and killing her own son Ydoulx

timeline.subject: Marguitte femme Jean Jacquot
timeline.details: Further reiteration of confession and taken before inhabitants to be handed over to justice of duke

timeline.subject: Marguitte femme Jean Jacquot
timeline.details: Death sentence from Change de Nancy

accomplices_named.name: Margo femme Grand Colas
accomplices_named.context: Named during initial confrontation on 7 February 1601

accomplices_named.name: femme Colas Melline
accomplices_named.context: Named during initial confrontation on 7 February 1601

accomplices_named.name: Marguitte femme Colas Jean Mengenot le vieux
Jean Gelyat
accomplices_named.context: Seen at sabbat, described as one of the principal members

prior_accusations.context: Executed previous year (1600). Had accused Marguitte of being a witch and killing Jean Parmentier of Sauceray. Multiple witnesses reported hearing this accusation.

notable_quotes.speaker: Marguitte femme Jean Jacquot
notable_quotes.french: ung bien gros coup pour elle
notable_quotes.context: When confronted about rumor that she killed Jean Parmentier, she said this without making any very clear denial

notable_quotes.speaker: Marguitte femme Jean Jacquot
notable_quotes.french: et depuis elle en at heu moult de regret, et en fut tellement despit√©e que jamais depuis, elle n'a voullu user de ladite pouldre a l'endroit d'aulcunes personnes que ce soit
notable_quotes.english: and since then she had much regret, and was so distressed that never since had she wanted to use the said powder against any person whatsoever
notable_quotes.context: After confessing to killing her 12-year-old son Ydoulx with powder in his milk

notable_quotes.speaker: Jehenne Michiel
notable_quotes.context: Warning to Claudatte femme Mengeon Grand Michiel about Marguitte, 5 years before Jehenne's execution

notable_quotes.speaker: Mengeotte femme Demenge Didier le Moullot
notable_quotes.context: Marguitte came to see her before confrontation, hugged her, and said she came to say adieu. This time she would not return, and did not care, except for shame she would bring on her relatives by being burned in public.

relationships.evidence_text: During first marriage to Didier Rattonge, time of great famine
daughter of Colas Martin of le Paire

relationships.person1: Mengeotte femme Demenge Didier le Moullot

relationships.person2: Mengeotte femme Demenge Didier le Moullot
relationships.evidence_text: Had been in their house spinning
Had been in her house frequently

harms_catalog.method_alleged: proximity - she entered house and looked over animals one after another

harms_catalog.harm_description: lost several animals in strange fashion
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Had taken Jean Grand Didier to court and summoned her as witness; she refused and conceived hatred
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: after the lawsuit (3 years before trial)

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: As maire had threatened her with punishment when she did not want to testify in lawsuit

harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: occurred after warning from mother-in-law 5 years before

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: had been angry with her son
harms_catalog.method_alleged: black powder in bowl of milk
black powder, on orders of her master

material_culture.context: Given by devil to kill animals
Given by devil to kill people
What the promised money turned out to be
Put powder in bowl of milk for her son
Fetching wood when seduced by devil, carrying it on shoulders due to poverty

spatial_references.context: Primary location of trial and residence of accused and most witnesses
Where seduction occurred (near Sauceray when fetching wood); home of Jean Parmentier and some sabbat attendees

spatial_references.place_name: le Paire in ban de Moyenmoustier

economic_hardship_indicators: Time of great famine mentioned during seduction
So poor they had no animals to carry wood, had to carry on shoulders
Persin promised money so she would no longer be hungry
Demenge Didier le Moullat reduced to poverty from losing so many animals

prior_legal_disputes.description: Mengeon Claude Mariatte had taken Jean Grand Didier to court seeking reparation for execrable words against his late father. Marguitte was summoned as witness and refused several times until forced by court.
prior_legal_disputes.outcome: She was forced to testify but conceived hatred against Mengeon Claude Mariatte

hearsay_chains.content: she was a witch and had killed late maire Jean Parmentier of Sauceray

hearsay_chains.reporter: Marguitte veuve Claudon Claude Jean Mariatte
hearsay_chains.content: she was a witch and had killed Jean Parmentier
general reputation since accusation by Jehenne Michiel
on deathbed Jean Parmentier claimed she had bewitched him

hearsay_chains.reporter: Mengeotte femme Demenge Didier le Moullot

hearsay_chains.content: she was 'une parfaite sorciere' and intended to do her harm
Marguitte said to her one day in fields that a great black man had met her and frightened her, after which she had been ill

emotional_state_notes: After first accusation by Jehenne Michiel thought she would not be arrested because she had always been careful to avoid quarrels
After second accusation had decided to confess freely once arrested
Came to say adieu to Mengeotte, said she would not return and did not care except for shame she would bring on relatives by being burned in public
Much regret after killing her son, was so distressed she never used powder against people again

third_parties.name: Jean Grand Didier
third_parties.context: Alias Remeguey, maintained accusation during confrontation. His wife Georgeatte was named as sabbat attendee. Was party to lawsuit 3 years earlier.

third_parties.name: Georgeatte femme Jean Grand Didier
third_parties.context: Named as having been seen at sabbat

third_parties.name: Jean Parmentier
third_parties.context: Maire of Sauceray who threatened her with punishment when she refused to testify. She confessed to killing him with yellow powder. Multiple witnesses reported he claimed on deathbed she bewitched him.

third_parties.name: Jehenne Michiel
third_parties.context: Executed previous year (1600). Had publicly accused Marguitte of being a witch and killing Jean Parmentier. Seen at sabbat. Called Marguitte 'une parfaite sorciere'.

third_parties.name: Ydoulx
third_parties.context: Son of Marguitte, aged 12 when she killed him with powder in milk 8 years before trial

third_parties.name: Didier Rattonge
third_parties.context: First husband during time of great famine when she was seduced by Persin

third_parties.name: Colas Martin
third_parties.context: Father of accused, from le Paire in ban de Moyenmoustier

third_parties.name: Jean Gelyat
third_parties.context: Already executed, from Sauceray. Named as one of principal members of sabbat.

third_parties.name: Barbeline
third_parties.context: Already executed, from Sauceray. Seen at sabbat.

third_parties.name: Marion veuve Demenge Arnoulx
third_parties.context: Already executed, from Sauceray. Seen at sabbat.

third_parties.name: Mengeon Grand Michiel
third_parties.context: Husband of witness 10, son of Jehenne Michiel

third_parties.name: Colas Jean Mengenot le vieux
third_parties.context: His wife Marguitte was named as having been seen at sabbat

extraction_metadata.notes: Clear trial record with detailed confession. Marguitte confessed freely after confrontation, without torture. Notable for her confession to killing her own son and expressing deep regret. Economic hardship (famine) as context for seduction. Strong network of prior accusations from Jehenne Michiel.
